opportunities.name: Friendship Partner Program // World Relief
opportunities.description: An American friend (1-4 people) who can help a refufee become self-sufficient and find their confidence in America. Time spent together should encouraage and reinforce American cultural concepts while learning about each other's culture. (3 hours a week, 6 month commitment).

opportunities.name: English Tutor // World Relief
opportunities.description: Visit a refugee family or individual two times a week to help them learn basic English

opportunities.name: High school refugee mentor // World Relief
opportunities.description: Develop relationships with high school refugee students and help prepare them for graduation and life after high school. Mentors play a valuable role in social and emotional development, provide insight and access to local American culture, and act as an external support system

opportunities.name: Childcare Assistant // Nashville Center for Empowerment (N.I.C.E)
opportunities.description: Work with children of all ages as their parents attend English classes on site. Volunteers are welcome to bring their own children. Opportunities are available Monday through Thursday, morning (9 a.m. ‐ 1 p.m. and evenings (6 ‐ 8 p.m.), according to our class offerings. We ask for 2 ‐ 4 hour commitment each week.

opportunities.name: Friend to a refugee elder // Catholic Charities
opportunities.description: American friend partners one on one with a refugee senior to reduce client's social isolation, to provide much-needed companionship and to help our elderly refugees explore their new community safely.

opportunities.name: Kindergarten Program // Legacy Mission Village
opportunities.description: Legacy Mission Village teacher help prepare refugee children and their parents to enroll in local schools by reducing the culture and readiness gap that exists between refugee children and their American peers

opportunities.name: Literary Tutor // Nashville Literacy Council
opportunities.description: One-on-One tutors meet with learners two to three hours per week. We suggest meeting two times a week for one and a half hours per session.

opportunities.name: Move in teams // Catholic Charities
opportunities.description: Assists with moving in furniture and setting up apartments and houses for newly arrived refugees.

opportunities.name: Family mentor // Legacy Mission Village
opportunities.description: Vist a refugee family or individual two times a week to help them learn basic English

opportunities.name: ESL-To-Go
opportunities.description: $70: One term of English class for a student

opportunities.name: Catholic Charities
opportunities.description: $25 Provides one week of supplies, snacks, homework assistance and hands-on activities to a refugee youth in our after-school program.

opportunities.name: Furniture Donation // World Relief
opportunities.description: Used furniture needed: dining room sets, dressers, coffee tables, end tables & couches.
